p: The first direct evidence of the presence ZIKV in the Asian continent and the first proof of its transmission by an urban vector was found through the isolation of the virus from A. aegypti mosquitoes in Malaysia in 1966 [ 4, 5]. After 11 years of this observation, the first human infections in Asia were discovered in central Java of Indonesia in patients having fever, malaise, stomach ache, anorexia, and dizziness [ 6].
